articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits New Houses and Pyongyang University of Dance
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits New Houses and Pyongyang University of Dance
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, gave on-the-spot guidance to newly-built apartment houses and reconstructed Pyongyang University of Dance.
					The first leg of his guidance was the new apartment houses built at the foot of time-honored Haebang Hill.
					
					After being briefed on the houses in front of a map of panoramic view, he went round them to learn in detail about their construction.
					
					Saying that the interior of houses is well designed for dwellers' convenience, he expressed great pleasure over the fact that the people were provided with another better houses.
					
					They are flawlessly perfect in aspects of design and construction, he said, highly praising the builders for having successfully finished the construction of the modern houses of the highest level.
					
					He stressed with pride that it is a demonstration of the validity of the WPK's idea of bringing about a radical turn in architecture and the potentiality of the DPRK's independent economy to have successfully built another modern residential quarters of peculiar style suited to the requirement of the new century with domestic building materials and technology.
					
					He set forth important tasks that would serve as guidelines for sprucing up the capital city of Pyongyang more magnificently.
					
					If Pyongyang is to be built into a world-leading city impeccable even in the distant future, it is important to ensure the layout of streets, the construction of roads and the arrangement and style of various buildings in a peculiar and far-sighted way as required by the developing reality and well arrange facilities for education, public health, physical training and cultural and welfare service and other public service establishments on the principle of ensuring the serve-the-people spirit, the national character and modernity on the top level.
					
					The next leg of his guidance was reconstructed Pyongyang University of Dance.
					
					After being briefed on its layout and interior structure, he looked round the room dedicated to its history. He recalled with deep emotion the glorious course covered by the university while seeing the historic materials and data on the immortal guidance of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					After its birth the university has produced a great number of competent artistes over the past 60 odd years, thus making significant contribution to the development of the Juche-oriented art, he said, highly estimating the achievements made by it.
					
					Then he made the rounds of several places of the university including modernly equipped practice rooms and a splendidly-built dance theatre to acquaint himself in detail with the reconstruction and education facilities of the university.
					
					Noting that the university is well furnished with all necessary education facilities as befitting a palace of education in art of dance, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the university has been successfully built on a modern basis.
					
					The university is a valuable asset of the country, he said, advancing the tasks for intellectual and ideological education.
					
					He expressed belief that its teachers and students would live up to the trust and expectation of the WPK by ushering in the fresh heyday of education in art of dance.
					
					Accompanying him were Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Choe Thae Bok and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Jong Sun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myo
					
					 ng Su, department directors of the NDC.

articles.title: Panmunjom Mission of KPA Sends Notice to U.S. Forces Side
articles.content:
Panmunjom Mission of KPA Sends Notice to U.S. Forces Side
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- As already reported, the south Korean puppet war-like forces Tuesday committed another grave military provocation such as firing shells into the territorial waters of the DPRK side in the West Sea of Korea.
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK took a prompt and resolute physical counter-action against the provocateurs who dared fire even shells into the territorial waters of the DPRK side while staging the maneuvers for a war of aggression against it codenamed Hoguk.
					
					 This once again confirmed the unshakable stand of the army of the DPRK not to allow even in the least anyone to encroach upon its inviolable territorial waters.
					
					 There came from the U.S. forces side a notice blaming the DPRK under the absurd charge that the recent shelling took place in the area under its military control and it was a "violation of the Armistice Agreement."
					
					 The Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army today sent the following notice to the U.S. forces side in connection with its attempt to misrepresent the incident, while thoughtlessly shielding the south Korean puppet forces who dared make a preempt shelling at the DPRK:
					
					 The south Korean puppet warmongers' firing of shells into the territorial waters of the DPRK side in the West Sea of Korea on Nov. 23 was a premeditated and deliberate military provocation from A to Z and a war action in fact.
					
					 On Nov. 22, the south Korean puppet forces made no scruple of announcing that they would fire shells into the territorial waters of the DPRK side with artillery pieces they deployed on Yonphyong Island while staging Hoguk exercises for a war of aggression against the DPRK, straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 In this connection the DPRK side sent a telephone notice to the south Korean puppet military at 8 a.m. on Nov. 23, strongly urging it to immediately cancel the plan for firing shells into the territorial waters of the DPRK side. In the notice the DPRK side seriously warned that if it paid no heed to this demand, it would face a resolute physical counter-strike and would be held fully responsible for all the ensuing consequences.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces, obsessed by hysteria for invasion of the DPRK, committed such reckless military provocation as preempting the firing of shells into the territorial waters of the DPRK side in the West Sea of Korea by mobilizing artillery pieces deployed on Yonphyong Island, defying the repeated efforts made by the DPRK to prevent military conflicts and preserve peace and stability in the said waters.
					
					 The island, therefore, played the role of an outpost from which a military provocation was perpetrated against the DPRK and it deserved punishment meted out by the army of the DPRK according to its self-defensive measure.
					
					 The Panmunjom Mission of the KPA in the notice particularly emphasized the fact that the U.S. forces side, too, is to blame for the incident.
					
					 The West Sea of Korea turned into disputed waters always fraught with the danger of confrontation and clash between the north and the south because of the illegal "northern limit line" unilaterally fixed by the U.S. inside the territorial waters of the DPRK. The U.S., therefore, cannot evade the blame for the recent shelling. 
					
					 If the U.S. forces side truly desires the detente on the Korean Peninsula, it should not thoughtlessly shelter the south Korean puppet forces but strictly control them so that they may not commit any more adventurous military provocations such as intruding into the waters of the DPRK side and shelling for the purpose of defending the illegal "northern limit line".
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to prove that it is the south Korean puppet forces which actually violated the Armistice Agreement and it was none other than the U.S. which sparked off the conflict in the above-said waters.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are foolishly contemplating an additional provocation aimed to orchestrate another farce and charade such as the "Cheonan" case while kicking up rows and holding confabs one after another such as the declaration of a "state of emergency" and "a meeting of ministers in charge of security," far from drawing due lesson from the recent shelling.
					
					 The Korean People's Army will deal without hesitation the second and third strong physical retaliatory blow if the south Korean puppet warmongers commit another reckless military provocation out of all reason.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to drop its inveterate bad habit of pulling up others, falsifying the truth about the situation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Grave of Mao Anying
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Grave of Mao Anying 
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, sent a wreath to the grave of Mao Anying in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of his death in battle.
					 The wreath was placed on Thursday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Representative of WHO
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Representative of WHO
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Sarveshwar Puri, representative of the World Health Organization to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Mao Anying
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Mao Anying
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of Mao Anying in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province, on Thursday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Mao's death in action.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health and chairman of the C.C., the DPRK-China Friendship Association, officials of party and power bodies in South Phyongan Province and Hoechang County, officers and men of the KPA and working people in the county and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here and members of the moviemaking team of Chinese serial TV drama "Mao Anying".
					
					 Placed before the grave were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea, the South Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK and the South Phyongan Provincial People's Committee, the Hoechang County Committee of the WPK and the Hoechang County People's Committee and wreaths in the name of the Chinese embassy and the Chinese moviemaking team.
					
					 A wreath in the name of the moviemaking team was placed before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Mao Anying and fighters of the CPV who fell while fighting heroically in the Korean War.
					
					 Then they visited the former Command of the CPV in Hoechang County.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Suriname
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Suriname
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Desi  Bouterse, president of Suriname, on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, Kim in the message sincerely wished the president great success in his work for the unity of the nation and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Vietnam Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Vietnam Appointed
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Chang Il was appointed as DPRK ambassador e. p. to Vietnam, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Noble Traits of Anti-Japanese Heroine
articles.content:
Noble Traits of Anti-Japanese Heroine
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- On November 25, 65 years ago, anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk, together with her son, General Secretary Kim Jong Il, had the first emotion-packed meeting with fellow countrymen in the homeland after the victory in the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					 On this anniversary, the Korean people are recollecting the precious revolutionary life of the modest and honest heroine, who always shared weal and woe with the people.
					
					 Even after the liberation of the country, she lived an industrious and frugal life, apart from any privilege.
					
					 One day Kim Jong Il saw his mother working on a vegetable garden with her face streaming with sweat and her footwear and clothes stained with mud, and approached her to clean them.
					
					 But she told her son that those engaging in farming should not have a dislike to mud and that land would give fruits as much as they work. She also said that they would feel the value of hard working when picking up fruits cultivated by themselves. 
					
					 The other day a peasant came to Pyongyang to donate rice to the country out of patriotism. When he unloaded straw rice bags from a cart, a woman helped him and brought washing water to him. At that time he did not know she was Kim Jong Suk, respected by all people. 
					
					 It is also a well-known story that she joined in the patriotic work for the Pothong River improvement and in rice-planting on Mirim fields. 
					
					 The noble traits of the heroine, who devoted herself to the country, the people and the revolution, still encourage the Korean people to strive hard for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: National Vocal and Instrumental Solo Contest of Unionists Held
articles.content:
National Vocal and Instrumental Solo Contest of Unionists Held
 Pyongyang November 25 (KCNA) -- A national vocal and instrumental solo contest of officials and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea took place at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex.
					 The contest drew more than 100 union officials and members selected at the contests held in the capital city of Pyongyang and provinces, cities and counties.
					
					 The participants fully displayed the skills they have trained through their brisk mass cultural and artistic activities.
					
					 They successfully represented with rich voice such songs as immortal classic masterpiece "Where Are You, Dear General?", "Looks of Korea" and "Song of Pace-setters of Chollima Movement", songs from five revolutionary operas and folk songs.
					
					 They also skillfully played solos with such instruments as kayagum, accordion and harmonica.

articles.title: Proclamation Day of State of Mongolia Marked
articles.content:
Proclamation Day of State of Mongolia Marked
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition opened at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Thursday to mark the 86th anniversary of the proclamation of the State of Mongolia.
					 Present at the inaugural ceremony were Jon Yong Jin, chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association and vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, working people in the city and Ambassador Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here and other Mongolian guests.
					
					 Diplomatic envoys and embassy officials of various countries here were present there on invitation.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers referred to the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Mongolia which have been developed in various fields, voicing belief that the exhibition would contribute to deepening the friendly ties between the two peoples.

articles.title: Industrialization of Magnesia Production Completed
articles.content:
Industrialization of Magnesia Production Completed
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK completed the project for industrializing the production of magnesia clinker and light burned magnesia by pellet anthracite by expanding last year's achievements in producing magnesia clinker without use of coking coal, and thus turned the Tanchon Magnesia Factory into a leading comprehensive refractory producer. 
					 The factory finished the major projects including large-scale pellet anthracite production process to establish the Korean-style system of producing fireproof materials and increase its production capacity. This helps the DPRK turn out at will quality magnesia clinker and light burned magnesia by means of anthracite abundant in the country.
					
					 Control programs suited to the features of pellet anthracite production process and process of producing light burned magnesia through gasification of anthracite have been developed to build a computer-controlled system for pellet anthracite production process and kiln.
					
					 Besides, the processes of producing tile, brick and packing container with by-products from the course of magnesia clinker production, etc. were built at the factory to lay a solid material and technical foundation for processing and utilizing the raw fireproof materials in an overall way.

articles.title: New Nutrients Developed
articles.content:
New Nutrients Developed
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Microbiological Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has made nutritive powder with Grifola frondosa, a mushroom belonging to Polyporaceae.
					The mushroom contains bioproducts raising immunity in human body, lowering cholesterol in blood and stabilizing blood sugar and blood pressure.
					
					The powder, easy to manufacture in any place, is very efficacious for radiation damage, liver disorder, digestive trouble, hypertension, diabetes and skin disease.
					
					The O-Il Pharmaceutical Factory has made nutritive pills with asteroid.
					
					The drug, with a large amount of minerals and vitamins, is not only good for mental and physical fatigue but potent for liver disorder, vascular trouble, gastric and duodenal ulcers and obesity.
					
					It also prevents aging and improves retentive faculty, while giving no sideeffect.
					
					Its manufacturing technology was highly appreciated at the 11th National Exhibition of Inventions and New Technologies held some time ago.

articles.title: Statement of South Headquarters of Pomminryon
articles.content:
Statement of South Headquarters of Pomminryon
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) released a statement on Nov. 20 to mark the 20th anniversary of the formation of Pomminryon.
					 The statement said that all Koreans are filled with confidence and will to get united under the banner of "By our nation itself" and achieve the independent reunification, peace and prosperity on the occasion of the said anniversary.
					
					 After its formation Pomminryon has steadily advanced along the road of national independence and great national unity despite the persistent repressive moves on the part of the U.S. and the anti-reunification forces, it noted.
					
					 Underlining the need to realize the national reconciliation and unity through strict implementation of the inter-Korean declarations and wage an anti-U.S. struggle for independence on a wider scale, the statement called on all the fellow countrymen to get united under the banner of "By our nation itself" to achieve the national reunification at an early date.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige taller de vidrio y fabrica de agua mineral
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige taller de vidrio y fabrica de agua mineral
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el taller de vidrio resistente recien construido en la Fabrica de Vidrio de Amistad de Taean y la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Agua Mineral de Kangso.
					　El Dirigente visito primero el nuevo taller.
					
					Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el plano del taller, recorrio el proceso de produccion de vidrio de reflexion de rayos infrarrojos y el de vidrio resistente averiguando en detalles el estado de construccion, dotacion tecnica y produccion.
					
					Al ver varios productos de vidrio que salen en cadena del taller donde estan alineados los equipos mecanicos ultramodernos, se puso muy satisfecho de que la fabrica haya construido excelentemente en un corto plazo por cuenta propia este taller moderno que produce los articulos de segunda elaboracion que requieren de tecnologias sofisticadas y produjera en gran cantidad el vidrio especial y varios productos de vidrio de buena calidad.
					
					Dijo que el nuevo taller ha sido acondicionado magnificamente conforme a la demanda de la epoca de IT desde el diseno hasta la ejecucion y dotacion tecnica.
					
					Elogio a los empleados de la fabrica por haber hecho otra creacion orgullosa que contribuira a abrir la nueva era de prosperidad de la epoca del Songun haciendo uso de su indoblegable fuerza espiritual.
					
					Al examinar varios productos del taller como los vidrios de reflexion de rayos infrarrojos de colores gris plateado, plateado, pardo claro y azul y los articulos hechos con vidrio resistente, entre otros, la puerta de entrada, ventanillas de autos y tren y muebles de vidrio, se mostro contento por su alta calidad.
					
					Este taller produce los articulos de vidrio especial de diferentes usos tomando como materia prima la placa de vidrio que se produce en grandes cantidades con la arena abundante en nuestro pais, apunto y continuo que por lo tanto, resulta la base productora de articulos de vidrio con gran perspectiva y rentabilidad.
					
					El Dirigente presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la administracion y operacion del taller.
					
					Evaluo altamente el hecho de que los obreros de la fabrica normalizan en alto nivel la produccion y apunto que aumentar incesantemente la produccion poniendo en pleno funcionamiento esta fabrica, simbolo de amistad Corea-China, es importante para manifestar la vitalidad de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.
					
					　Acto seguido, el Dirigente dirigio la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Agua Mineral de Kangso.
					
					Tras escuchar de los efectos medicinales de agua mineral y el historial de la fabrica que le conto un funcionario responsable de esta, recorrio la fuente de agua medicinal y los lugares de toma y elaboracion cerciorandose detalladamente del estado de equipos tecnicos y de produccion.
					
					Mirando el agua mineral en erupcion constante, dijo que en esta fabrica estan impregnadas las imborrables hazanas de direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, quien durante toda su vida realizo ingentes esfuerzos fisicos y espirituales por la felicidad del pueblo amandolo tanto, y agrego que nuestro pueblo no olvidara nunca la enorme benevolencia de el.
					
					　Se puso muy alegre al ver los talleres de trabajo bien ordenados en que esta garantizada la seguridad higienica y las botellas de agua mineral que se producen sin cesar en la cadena modernizada con la tecnologia CNC.
					
					　Expreso su gran satisfaccion de que los funcionarios y obreros de la fabrica hayan acondicionado excelentemente y operaran bien esta moderna fabrica dotada de equipos ultramodernos.
					
					Esta planta tiene importante deber y papel en proteger y fomentar la salud del pueblo, subrayo y presento las tareas que incumben a ella.
					
					La tarea importante de la fabrica es incrementar la produccion de agua mineral y elevar mas su calidad, dijo y enfatizo en que para este fin, es preciso seguir impulsando activamente la modernizacion y la fundamentacion cientifica de la fabrica, contar con la ayuda del Ministerio de Salud Publica y otras unidades relacionadas y solucionar satisfactoriamente el problema de recipientes.
					
					Puesto que esta fabrica maneja las bebidas de consumo popular, hay que seguir prestando profunda atencion a la creacion del ambiente higienico y cultural, enseno.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y obreros de la fabrica produciran en gran medida la famosa y muy salubre agua mineral de Kangso y la suministraran mucho mas al pueblo dando pruebas de su disposicion de servir abnegadamente para este. 
					
					　Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Kuk Thae, miembro del Buro Politico (BP) y presidente de la Comision de Control del CC del PTC, Choe Thae Bok y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP, secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Jong Sun, miembro suplente del BP y primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, jefes de departamento del CDN.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante la tumba de Mao Anying
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante la tumba de Mao Anying
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio una ofrenda floral ante la tumba de Mao Anying en el distrito de Hoechang de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur con motivo del 60 aniversario de su caida en combate. 
					　La ofrenda floral fue colocada el dia 25.

articles.title: Esta destapada todavia la boca de canones del EPC, declara MINREX
articles.content:
Esta destapada todavia la boca de canones del EPC, declara MINREX
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 24 la siguiente declaracion:
					　Como ha informado la Comandancia Suprema del Ejercito Popular de Corea, nuestras fuerzas armadas revolucionarias tomaron la resuelta medida de autodefensa frente a la aventurera provocacion militar de los enemigos que dispararon el dia 23 desde la isla Yonphyong en el Mar Oeste de Corea hacia las aguas jurisdiccionales de nuestra parte.
					
					　Con respecto al plan de los enemigos de desplegar el connotado ejercicio belico "Hoguk" contra la RPDC y realizar al mismo tiempo el tiro de combate de artilleria en la isla Yonphyong, nuestro ejercito les advirtio en reiteradas ocasiones que asestaria el contraataque inmediato si cayera algun proyectil en las aguas jurisdiccionales de nuestra parte.
					
					　A las 8 de la manana del 23, dia del incidente, el jefe de nuestra delegacion a las conversaciones militares Norte-Sur envio a su homologo surcoreano el aviso telefonico volviendo a exigirle fuertemente la cancelacion del plan de canonazo en alrededores de la isla Yonphyong, punto delicado.
					
					　Sin embargo, los enemigos incurrieron en la muy imprudente provocacion militar de disparar finalmente a partir de las 13 de ese dia decenas de obuses hacia las aguas jurisdiccionales de la parte Norte. 
					
					  A pesar de que existen en el Sur de Corea muchos montes, rios, mares e islas, los enemigos dispararon los canones desde esa isla en las mismas narices de nuestra parte donde ambas partes se distinguen a simple vista. Esta conducta resulta una provocacion que parte de un proposito politico muy importante.
					
					  Los enemigos excusan que han disparado hacia el sur desde la isla para no irritar a nuestra parte. Pero, la isla Yonphyong esta situada bien dentro de nuestras aguas jurisdiccionales desde la linea de demarcacion militar maritima. Por esta caracteristica geografica, si se realiza el tiro de canones desde esa isla en cualquier direccion, sus obuses caen automaticamente en las aguas jurisdiccionales de nuestra parte.
					
					  Los enemigos pretendian anunciar que la RPDC reconocio la zona maritima alrededor de la polemica isla como "aguas jurisdiccionales" de la parte Sur en caso de que no hubieran las contramedidas fisicas de nuestra parte. He aqui el caracter astuto y siniestro de la presente provocacion militar. 
					
					  Nuestro ejercito, que no habla por hablar, tomo inmediatamente la medida de autodefensa de atacar duro las baterias enemigas que abrieron el fuego.
					
					  El presente caso constituye otra peligrosa situacion  causada por la ilegal "linea de limite al Norte" delineada unilateralmente el 30 de agosto de 1953, despues de firmado el Acuerdo de Armisticio, por el entonces comandante de las "fuerzas de la ONU", Clark.
					
					  Estados Unidos, sus satelites y las autoridades de algunas organizaciones internacionales deben dejar su vicio de criticar a alguien antes de averiguar lo ocurrido realmente. 
					
					  Si defienden sin principios al Sur de Corea por ser su aliado aunque el ha cometido ese delito irrefutable, esto produciria el efecto de echar gasolina al fuego. 
					
					　Ahora nos controlamos con esfuerzos superhumanos porque apreciamos la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana. Pero, permanece destapada todavia la boca de canones de nuestro ejercito, defensor de la justicia.

articles.title: EE.UU. debe dejar su vicio de distorsionar los hechos
articles.content:
EE.UU. debe dejar su vicio de distorsionar los hechos
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Como ya trascendidos, el dia 23, los belicistas titeres surcoreanos perpetraron otra grave provocacion militar de abrir el fuego artillero hacia las aguas jurisdiccionales de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el Mar Oeste de Corea.
					  Nuestras fuerzas armadas revolucionarias asestaron inmediata y resueltamente el contragolpe fisico a los provocadores que incurrieron en ese canonazo desplegando el ejercicio belico "Hoguk" para la agresion a la RPDC.
					
					  Esto confirmo una vez mas la ferrea posicion de nuestro ejercito de no perdonar ni en lo minimo a cualesquier tipejos que se atrevan a tocar las sagradas aguas jurisdiccionales de la patria.
					
					   Sin embargo, la parte norteamericana envio a nuestra parte un aviso acusandonos con el absurdo alegato de que el presente canonazo tuvo lugar en la zona de su control militar y nuestra reaccion fue una "violacion del Acuerdo de Armisticio".
					
					  En relacion con que la parte de tropas norteamericanas intenta distorsionar lo ocurrido realmente defendiendo a ciegas a los titeres surcoreanos, que se atrevieron a abrir primero el fuego contra nuestra parte, la Representacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea en Phanmunjom envio el dia 25 a aquella el siguiente aviso:
					
					  Los canonazos cometidos el dia 23 por los belicistas titeres surcoreanos hacia las aguas jurisdiccionales de nuestra parte en el Mar Oeste de Corea son de punta a cabo una provocacion militar premeditada y practicamente, una accion belica.
					
					  Los titeres surcoreanos, que vinieron agravando la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana librando el ejercicio belico llamado "Hoguk" para la agresion a la RPDC, publicaron sin escrupulos el dia 22 el plan provocativo de disparar hacia las aguas jurisdiccionales de nuestra parte con sus canones desplegados en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					  Al respecto, a traves del aviso telefonico mandado a las 8 del dia 23, nuestra parte demando fuertemente al circulo militar titere surcoreano la cancelacion inmediata de tal plan advirtiendo severamente que si no escucha esa demanda, afrontara un resuelto contragolpe fisico y asumira la entera responsabilidad de todas las consecuencias.
					
					  Despreciando los repetidos esfuerzos de nuestra parte por prevenir el conflicto armado en el Mar Oeste de Corea y mantener la paz y la estabilidad de esta zona maritima, los titeres surcoreanos enloquecidos por agredir a la RPDC cometieron por fin la imprudente provocacion militar de disparar primero hacia nuestras aguas jurisdiccionales en el Mar Oeste de Corea movilizando las fuerzas artilleras ubicadas en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					  Por fin, esta isla devino el foco de provocacion militar contra la RPDC y ha sido castigada merecidamente segun la medida de autodefensa del EPC.
					
					  Recae sobre la parte de tropas norteamericanas una parte de la responsabilidad del incidente.
					
					　Debido a la ilegal "linea de limite al Norte", fijada unilateralmente por EE.UU. en nuestras aguas jurisdiccionales, el Mar Oeste de Corea se convirtio en la zona litigiosa donde persisten el peligro de enfrentamiento y choque entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					  Por lo tanto, Estados Unidos no podra liberarse de la responsabilidad del presente cruce de obuses.
					
					  Si EE.UU. desea de veras el alivio de tension de la Peninsula Coreana, debe dejar de defender a ciegas a los titeres surcoreanos y controlarlos para que ellos no recurran mas a las aventureras provocaciones militares como la incursion en nuestras aguas maritimas y el disparo artillero para mantener la ilegal "linea de limite al Norte".
					
					  El presente incidente demuestra que los titeres surcoreanos son violadores reales del Acuerdo de Armisticio y fue EE.UU. el que sembro la semilla de conflictos en el Mar Oeste de Corea.
					
					  Pese a esta realidad, en vez de sacar debidas lecciones del suceso, EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos pretenden neciamente repetir el complot igual al incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta surcorena  "Cheonan" decretando el "estado de emergencia" y sosteniendo sucesivos debates de conspiracion como la "reunion de ministros encargados de seguridad".
					
					  Si los belicistas titeres surcoreanos vuelven a cometer imprudentes provocaciones militares sin recobrar el juicio, nuestro ejercito les dara sin vacilacion alguna el segundo y tercer golpes fisicos de represalia muy fuertes.
					
					  EE.UU. debe dejar su vicio cronico de criticar a otros tergiversando la verdad de lo ocurrido.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con Sarveshwar Puri
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reune con Sarveshwar Puri
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El canciller coreano, Pak Ui Chun, departio este jueves con Sarveshwar Puri, representante de la OMS, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.
